questions.q: Which of the following are the primary types of cables used as physical transmission media?
questions.explanation: The three main types of physical transmission media are twisted pair, coaxial, and fiber optic cables [1].

questions.q: Twisted pair cable consists of pairs of insulated ________ wires twisted together.
questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables are made of insulated copper wires [1].

questions.q: What are the two specific types of twisted pair cables?
questions.explanation: The two types are Unshielded Twisted Pair (UTP) and Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) [1].

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT listed as an advantage of twisted pair cables?
questions.explanation: Advantages include being cheaper, flexible, light weight, and easy to install, but the source does not claim they are immune to all interference [1].

questions.q: How many pairs of wires are found in a standard twisted Ethernet cable?
questions.explanation: Twisted Ethernet cables are comprised of four twisting pairs of wires [2].

questions.q: Which set of colors represents the four pairs in an Ethernet cable?
questions.explanation: The colors are orange, green, blue, and brown [2].

questions.q: In an Ethernet wire pair, what does the second wire typically look like?
options: A white wire with a stripe of the same color
A solid wire of a different color
questions.explanation: Each pair consists of a solid-colored wire and a white wire with a stripe of the same color [2].

questions.q: What is the name of the connector used to terminate twisted Ethernet cables?
questions.explanation: Ethernet cables are terminated with an RJ-45 connector [2].

questions.q: How many pins are on a standard RJ-45 connector?
questions.explanation: The RJ-45 connector has eight pins, numbered 1 to 8 [2].

questions.q: Twisted Ethernet cables transmit data using which type of signal?
questions.explanation: Twisted Ethernet cables transmit data using electrical signals [2].

questions.q: Fiber optic cables are categorized into which two modes?
questions.explanation: The two modes of fiber optic cables are Single mode and Multi-mode [1].

questions.q: True or False: Twisted pair cables are generally more expensive than fiber optic cables.
questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables are listed as being 'cheaper' [1].

questions.q: Which cable is described as being light in weight and easy to install?
questions.explanation: These are specific advantages of twisted pair cables [1].

questions.q: The pins on an RJ-45 connector correspond to what in the cable?
questions.explanation: The eight pins correspond to the wires in the cable [2].

questions.q: How many total individual wires are inside a four-pair twisted Ethernet cable?
questions.explanation: Since there are four pairs, there are 8 wires total [2].

questions.q: Which type of twisted pair cable includes extra protection against interference?
questions.explanation: STP stands for Shielded Twisted Pair, which includes shielding [1].

questions.q: True or False: Coaxial cable is a type of physical transmission medium.
questions.explanation: Coaxial is explicitly listed as one of the three cable types [1].

questions.q: What does UTP stand for?
questions.explanation: UTP stands for Unshielded Twisted Pair [1].

questions.q: What does STP stand for?
questions.explanation: STP stands for Shielded Twisted Pair [1].

questions.q: Essay: Briefly explain why wires are twisted in pairs according to general networking principles implied by the categories (UTP/STP).
options: Wires are twisted together to reduce electromagnetic interference (EMI) and crosstalk between the pairs.
questions.explanation: Twisting helps cancel out electromagnetic interference from external sources and other wires within the cable.

questions.q: In an Ethernet cable, the wire paired with the solid orange wire is:
questions.explanation: Each pair consists of a solid-colored wire and a white wire with a stripe of the same color [2].

questions.q: True or False: Fiber optic cables transmit data using electrical signals.
questions.explanation: Twisted Ethernet cables use electrical signals [2], while fiber optic uses light pulses (general knowledge consistent with cable distinctions).

questions.q: Which physical medium is likely best for long-distance, high-bandwidth needs based on the 'mode' categories?
questions.explanation: Fiber optic (Single/Multi-mode) is designed for higher performance [1].

questions.q: The RJ-45 connector is used specifically for which cable type in this lecture?
questions.explanation: It is used to terminate twisted Ethernet cables [2].

questions.q: True or False: Every Ethernet wire pair includes a white wire with a colored stripe.
questions.explanation: Yes, each of the four pairs follows this pattern [2].

questions.q: Which color is NOT one of the main color-coded pairs in an Ethernet cable?
questions.explanation: The colors are orange, green, blue, and brown. Red is not included [2].

questions.q: What is the primary material used for the conductor in twisted pair cables?
questions.explanation: Twisted pair consists of pairs of insulated copper wires [1].

questions.q: Which of the following describes the construction of a twisted pair cable?
options: Pairs of insulated copper wires twisted together
questions.explanation: This is the definition of twisted pair cable [1].

questions.q: True or False: UTP cables are harder to install than fiber optic cables.
questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables (including UTP) are described as 'easy to install' [1].

questions.q: The '8 pins' in an RJ-45 connector correspond to how many wires?
questions.explanation: The eight pins correspond to the eight total wires (four pairs) [2].

questions.q: Which cable type would be used if you needed a 'Shielded' connection?
questions.explanation: STP stands for Shielded Twisted Pair [1].

questions.q: True or False: Single mode and Multi-mode are types of Coaxial cables.
questions.explanation: They are types of Fiber Optic cables [1].

questions.q: The green wire in an Ethernet cable is paired with:
questions.explanation: Each solid wire is paired with a white wire with a stripe of the same color [2].

questions.q: True or False: Twisted pair cables are flexible.
questions.explanation: Flexibility is listed as one of their advantages [1].

questions.q: Which pins are present on an RJ-45 connector?
questions.explanation: The pins are numbered from 1 to 8 [2].

questions.q: Twisted pair cable wires are 'insulated'. What does this mean?
options: They are covered with a non-conductive material
questions.explanation: Insulation in cabling prevents electrical signals from leaking or shorting.

questions.q: True or False: Multi-mode is a type of fiber optic cable.
questions.explanation: The source lists Multi-mode under Fiber Optic [1].

questions.q: How many wire pairs are there for the color 'brown' in a standard cable?
questions.explanation: There is one brown pair (solid brown and white/brown stripe) [2].

questions.q: Which transmission medium is best for environments with heavy electrical interference based on its name?
questions.explanation: Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) is designed to handle such environments better [1].

questions.q: Essay: List the four color pairs in a standard twisted Ethernet cable.
options: The four color pairs are Orange, Green, Blue, and Brown.
